title: Wisconsin Veteran Memorials
name: Wisconsin Veteran Memorials
description:
A Map by Wicat2002

Wisconsin Veterans Memorials as Listed by the Wisconsin Department of Veterans Affairs

properties.name: Battle of the Bulge Memorial
properties.description: Posted by Wicat2002A memorial commemorating the Battle of the Bulge erected by the Northen Wisconsin Chapter of the Veterans of the Battle of the Bulge.

properties.name: Civil War Memorial
properties.description: Posted by Wicat2002A Civil War memorial erected by the Lysander Cutler Post # 55 of the Grand Army of the Republic. The monument was dedicated in 1886 and features a Civil War soldier in uniform standing on a base with cannons and cavalry swords.

properties.name: G.A.R Memorial
properties.description: Posted by Wicat2002Pine Grove Cemetery, Wausau, WI. An unusual G.A.R. memoiral cut from red granite with only the GAR badge carved on one side. There is no text to accompany the marker. The graves of six Civil War veterans surround the memorial, located in section 25 of the cemetery.

properties.name: Grand Army of the Republic and 30-lb Parrott Rifle
properties.description: Posted by Wicat20021516 Church St, stevens point, wi 54481This statue was dedicated on September 2, 1890 to honor the Civil War Union veterans from Portage County. There is also a parrott rifle with muzzle face inscription: "1864 W.P.F. & 4 HM R14 6 U.N. *360." Trunnion: "30 PDR."

properties.name: Hwy 10 Historical Marker-Prisoners of War
properties.description: Posted by Wicat2002Historical Marker remembering the 142,227 prisoners of war from WWI through Vietnam.

properties.name: In Memory of WWII Veterans
properties.description: Posted by Wicat2002

properties.name: Marathon County War Memorial
properties.description: Posted by Wicat2002Marathon County Courthouse, Wausau, WI. A red granite memorial featuring the names of Marathon county\'s war casualties from World War II, the Korean War, and the Vietnam War.

properties.name: Memorial Plaque-St. Stanislaus Catholic Church
properties.description: Posted by Wicat2002838 Fremont Street, stevens point, wi 54481World War II Plaque and statute

properties.name: Memorial to All Veterans 1982
properties.description: Posted by Wicat2002

properties.name: Mitchell Red Cloud Memorial
properties.description: Posted by Wicat2002A monument dedicated to Mitchell Red Cloud and other POWs and MIAs from the 24th Infantry in Korea. The memorial was donated by Don Hahn who is a veteran of the 24th Infantry.

properties.name: Stoughton Library Plaque
properties.description: Posted by Wicat2002304 South Fourth street, stoughton, wiList of fallen stoughton, wi soliders from the Civil War, WWI, WWII and Korea

properties.name: Sudut Memorial
properties.description: Posted by Wicat2002Memorial dedicated to Jerome A. Sudut, who recieved a Congressional Medal of Honor for his actions during the Korean War. Sudut served with the 25th Infantry Division and was killed in action. The memorial was dedicated November 11, 1988.

properties.name: Veterans Memorial Park
properties.description: Posted by Wicat2002

properties.name: Veterans Oblesik and Civil War Urn
properties.description: Posted by Wicat2002Riverside Cemetery, Stoughton, WIImpressive obelisk (with adjacent flagpole) commemorates those men & women from Stoughton that have "advanced the American Ideals of Liberty" during the "roar of conflict." Old, cracked urn worn away from exposure commemorates those who "died for the Union."

properties.name: Veterans Parkway
properties.description: Posted by Wicat2002A roadway in Marshfield dedicated in memory of the area\'s veterans. Designed to improve traffic flow in Marshfield.

properties.name: Veterans of Foreign Wars Post 10162
properties.description: Posted by Wicat2002

properties.name: WWI Guardian Angel
properties.description: Posted by Wicat2002Bronze statue of angel standing next to a WWI soldier. Statue is placed on top of a polished granite monument with attached benches. A plaque is affixed to the monument listing the names of county veterans who served in WWI. The statue honors those WWI veterans killed in action. Funded and maintained by VFW Burns Post #388. Grounds maintenance is performed by the Marathon County Buildings and Grounds Dept.

properties.name: Wisconsin Korean War Veterans Memorial
properties.description: Posted by Wicat2002Worzella Pines Park, Plover, WIMemorial situated on island in the center of Lake Pacawa. Dedicated on June 19, 1994.
